text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen when 
I was a kid my nanny used to ask me what do you

want for dinner and about 70 percent of the time 
I would tell her Pad tua fakyao which is what

we are making today now Pad means to stir-fry 
and tua fakyao is long beans so the simple

simple stir-fry of long beans and I wanted to 
share this recipe with you because beyond the

fact that it's really meaningful to me it's also 
super easy it's great for when you just have no

idea what else to do for dinner I have no time or 
it's also a great side dish to go with any kind

of meal whether it's Thai or not Thai so let's 
get started so I've got here some long beans so

what we're going to do is cut them into 2-inch 
pieces now if you don't have long beans this

recipe works great with regular green beans or I 
prefer the French beans which are just a little

bit thinner I like to do it on a bias so it just 
looks nicer on the plate and I just add an angle

like this now so I've got some garlic lots and 
lots of garlic for this one I'm going to really

just rough chop it because I do like the garlic in 
sort of big chunks still if you want you can also

add some shallots to this I'm showing you sort of 
the simple basic way and you can start dressing it

up however you want okay so the next thing I'm 
going to mix in our sauce now this sauce is so

versatile it's basically the standard stir-fry 
sauce I've used some variation of this in other

kinds of stir-fry as well so if you want you can 
just throw the beans out altogether and put in

another kind of vegetable I've just got some soy 
sauce in here I'm using mush time uh shroom soy

sauce and also some oyster sauce when I put ice 
in a container I always put a little bit of oil

in the container first and it helps it slide out 
a bit easier and I'm also going to add some golden

mountains sauce which it looks like this and it's 
just a different kind of soy sauce with slightly

different flavor you can also use Maggi seasoning 
and we'll have the same kind of effect not you can

just substitute more soy sauce optional ingredient 
I'm going to use add some shrimp tamale now shrimp

tamale in English it'll say shrimp paste with 
soybean oil it's completely optional if you don't

put it in it's still going to be super delicious 
and this is just my trick that I've developed

over the years and it's just going to add some 
extra sort of umami should be deliciousness an

extra layer of flavor so mix that up so it's 
ready to go when we go to cook it and my secret

ingredient now when I was a kid my Nana used to 
cook this with pork she always put some pork in

it but I've discovered that I really like salted 
duck eggs in this dish the salted duck eggs have

used it in a corn salad before it's basically duck 
eggs it's been soaked in salt water and over time

the salt just permeates the entire thing and when 
you cook it it turns the whites really really nice

and creamy it's just a great accent to a lot of 
dishes so when you get salted duck eggs just cut

right through it okay there's the shells still 
on there because the shells are really brittle

once it's been salted and you can't peel it I 
mean you can it'll take you forever just kind

of cut through it just make chunks kind of like 
you know avocado scoop it out from the shell so

what I'm going to do with this one is going to 
save it cut it nicely and then put it on top as

a garnish so I'm only just going to chunk this 
one okay so I've got my wok you can do this in

a large saute pan as well I'm just going to add a 
little bit of oil in goes my garlic I want to get

get the garlic some time to slowly infuse into 
the oil get the oil really nice and garlicky so

that the oil can then flavor everything else so 
once the garlic's starting to turn golden brown

like it is now go in with your beans I'll give 
it a quick toss and then what I'm going to do

is I'm going to add a splash of water to sort of 
give give the bean some Oh because without steam

it's really the beans we'll have a really hard 
time to cook so now I'm going to go in with all

my sauce mixture my white pepper I like a lot 
of white pepper I think you know that's by now

and then I'm also going to cut all the saltiness 
which we just add add it by a little bit of sugar

and especially if I'm going to add salted eggs to 
this I want to make sure that the there's enough

sweetness subtle sweetness to balance out the 
salty burst of the egg of the salted eggs and

now is the point where you're just going to keep 
cooking it stirring it frequently for about two

minutes until it's done to your liking some 
for some things I like really sort of crisp

undercook ish vegetables for this one I like it 
to still be a bit crunchy but for the most part

I like it to be nice and tender you don't have 
to stir it all the time you can let it hang out

for a few seconds and then go back to service 
now imagine you're replacing the standard great

roasted green beans at you know Thanksgiving 
a Christmas table or whatever it is with this

pie one how exciting see how my sauce is dried 
up noticeably at this point I can choose to add

a little bit more liquid or not again amount of 
sauce it's something under your control and okay

I'm liking that now I've done this lot so I know 
if I just dig my spatula into the bean sort of

there's the resistance that I get where I want it 
to be you can taste it if you want if you're not

sure okay I'm going to turn this off and then I 
am going to add my secret ingredients my salted a

half of it and toss that in and if you buy salted 
eggs and it looks doesn't look on the inside like

this one that's okay because sometimes the yolk 
isn't quite as orange sometimes the whites aren't

as salty there you go that's a beautiful side 
dish super easy that you can serve any time

let's plate it up now when I was growing up this 
dish actually had quite a bit of sauce pooling

on it but over the years our just experimented 
with different different ways of serving this

and actually liked it a bit tight because then 
the beans the sauce really coats the beans and

the beans are really flavorful but if you like a 
lot of sauce that can be poured over your rice you

might want to just add a little more water that 
looks good and the creaminess of the egg yolk

of the salted egg and the shrimp paste just helps 
sort of make the sauce a lot more luscious and get

the beans looking really shiny okay gonna put some 
of it on top just so it's a visual representation

of what's inside so people are not surprised 
unless of course you want to surprise them yeah

and there you go and if you want to you can put 
red stuff on it and make it a little more festive

mmm I'm so happy to be sharing this dish with 
you like it just is really the epitome of my

memory of what home-cooked timeyou is all about 
simplicity well balanced flavors and you know

might the salted egg is sort of my my Edition 
that has really made this dish mine and it kind

of represents the the growth of my culinary 
journey the egg is really nice and creamy

it's a salt it's a salty burst between every 
bite is just so good with some white rice so

I hope I hope this dish finds a spot on your 
table one of these days and when it does make

sure you take a photo and send it to me either 
through Facebook Twitter or Instagram and the

recipe as always on hot Tahitian calm and 
click to subscribe if you enjoy the shows

I can keep doing these shows for you and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious tiny
